item.title: Apple Watch heart features finally arrive, allowing people to take ECGs on their wrist - The Independent
item.description:
Apple Watch heart features finally arrive, allowing people to take ECGs on their wrist  The Independent

The Apple Watch's long promised heart features have finally arrived on people's watches. When the Series 4 was announced in September, the company said that it would let people take ECGs and see if their heartbeat is irregular. But it would not be available straight away because it had to be approved by regulators, it said at the time. Now the features have been given clearance by the US Food and Drug Administration and so will finally be available, arriving through a software update. The ECG and atrial fibrillation features are not yet available outside the US, including in the UK. A numbe...

item.title: Apple Watch Series 4 ECG Heart Rate Feature Now Live: Here's All You Need To Know - Forbes
item.description:
Apple Watch Series 4 ECG Heart Rate Feature Now Live: Here's All You Need To Know  Forbes

When Apple launched the latest Apple Watch Series 4 on September 12, one of the most exciting features is the capability to take ECG (electrocardiogram, also known as EKG) readings from your wrist. Apple Watch Series 4 now boasts the ECG feature But it had only just been cleared by the FDA, so the software needed more work before it could go live. The company said that it would happen this year but no date was given. It was the subject of much debate. It’s just gone live. It is currently limited to Apple Watches that have been bought and are being used in the U.S., and further locations wil...

item.title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta tests the Apple Watch's new ECG heart monitor - CNN
item.description:
Dr. Sanjay Gupta tests the Apple Watch's new ECG heart monitor  CNN

Since the Apple Watch Series 4 was announced in September, one of its most anticipated functions has been the promise to perform a mobile electrocardiogram (ECG or EKG) whenever a consumer wants. The feature becomes available in the United States on Thursday via a software update. This new ECG app represents a big venture into health for Apple. The company's ambition is for Apple and health to become as closely linked as Apple and music. It even produced a commercial featuring people who say the Apple Watch has helped them lead healthier lives. Apple says its new ECG application and the abi...

item.title: Snip, snip: Morgan Stanley latest to cut Apple target on China woes - Financial Times
item.description:
Snip, snip: Morgan Stanley latest to cut Apple target on China woes  Financial Times

The Apple price cut club welcomed a new member on Friday after Morgan Stanley blamed the Chinese smartphone market for weakening the outlook for iPhone sales. Flattening iPhone sales have stoked concerns on Wall Street that consumer demand has peaked for Apple’s most important device. In September, the tech giant offered a weaker than expected forecast for the holiday quarter and said it would no longer offer a quarterly breakdown of sales for each of its devices. Meanwhile, key iPhone suppliers have lowered financial guidance, and the Wall Street Journal reported last month that Apple redu...

item.title: AirPods 2: New Patent Reveals Noise-Canceling, Biometrics And Profound Design Change - Forbes
item.description:
AirPods 2: New Patent Reveals Noise-Canceling, Biometrics And Profound Design Change  Forbes

Apple AirPods 2 are not yet with us, though they may be coming early next year. The current AirPods are “Apple’s most popular accessory ever”, according to reliable analyst Ming-Chi Kuo. Apple’s opening video at its recent keynote features AirPods. There have already been hints that new features, such as hands-free “Hey, Siri” will be coming very soon. And now, it’s come to light that a patent that has just been granted, which has been spotted by 9to5Mac. It refers to “Earbuds with compliant member” and deals with “earbuds configured with one or more biometric sensors”. A compliant member, ...

item.title: China's Xiaomi takes lead over Apple as top seller of wearable technology globally - The Telegraph
item.description:
China's Xiaomi takes lead over Apple as top seller of wearable technology globally  The Telegraph

Chinese smartphone specialist Xiaomi has taken a lead over Apple as the world’s largest manufacturer of wearables, according to new figures from an industry analyst. A report from the International Data Corporation found that Xiaomi took top position in the third quarter of 2018 following positive sales of its Mi Band 3, a fitness tracker. Xiaomi’s push into markets such as India, Europe and the Middle East has been attributed to its overtaking of Apple. The share of the company’s deliveries within its home market has dropped from 80pc to 61pc as its international expansion plans pick up pa...

item.title: Apple patents interchangeable AirPods with health tracking features - The Telegraph
item.description:
Apple patents interchangeable AirPods with health tracking features  The Telegraph

Apple is working on interchangeable AirPod headphones that come with health tracking features to measure heart rate and stress levels. That's according to a new patent filed by the firm which reveals how a new version of its wireless in-ear headphones would be able to fit in either ear. The filing shows the device slipping into the ear canal and being held in place with a bendable band. Apple's current wireless AirPods were first launched in 2016, although some users have complained they can easily fall out or become uncomfortable. Apple removed the headphone jack from its iPhone models fro...

item.title: Apple iPhone Sales Off To A Slow Start This Holiday Season - Forbes
item.description:
Apple iPhone Sales Off To A Slow Start This Holiday Season  Forbes

The iPhone XS, left, and XS Max are displayed side to side during an event to announce new products at Apple headquarters Wednesday, Sept. 12, 2018, in Cupertino, Calif. (AP Photo/Marcio Jose Sanchez) photo credit: ASSOCIATED PRESS The day after the keynote address, Consumer Purchase Intent Data was already telling us that Apple was going to have a very rough road ahead of it. Since then, the stock has fallen big. More importantly, the holiday shopping season has begun. This gives us fresh consumer insights to tap into from the first week of the season. 2018 Holiday Slowdown? Black Friday...

item.title: How Incentives -- And a Free Apple Watch -- Make People Healthier - Forbes
item.description:
How Incentives -- And a Free Apple Watch -- Make People Healthier  Forbes

The Vitaly Apple Watch offer. When Discovery Health began offering Apple Watches as part of its Vitality wellness program it gave South Africa’s largest medical insurer the opportunity to prove one of its fundamental tenants: people will be healthier if they have an incentive. Or at least exercise more. Discovery announced that a two-year study of 400,000 people using an Apple Watch in conjunction with its Vitality Active Rewards program that offers incentives for meeting exercise goals delivered “dramatic and sustained improvements in physical activity levels”. These were on average 34% mo...

item.title: AirPods 2 New Rumor: Coming Early 2019, All-New Design In 2020 - Forbes
item.description:
AirPods 2 New Rumor: Coming Early 2019, All-New Design In 2020  Forbes

Apple’s AirPods and an updated version which may be called AirPods 2, are the subject of a research note from top analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, just revealed. Apple AirPods… are the updated earbuds almost here? In it, Kuo says that the latest version of something he calls “Apple’s most popular accessory ever” will not be with us in time for Christmas. Still, previously hinted improvements such as hands-free “Hey, Siri” may not be off the table, let’s hope. In the research note, seen by 9to5Mac and also by MacRumors, there are indications of how the new AirPods will differ from the current model and...

item.title: The Essential Travel Tech For An Active Getaway - Forbes
item.description:
The Essential Travel Tech For An Active Getaway  Forbes

Now that the cold winter months are upon us, and it’s still dark outside when the morning alarm goes off, it’s hard not to dream of those summer months. It’s hardly surprising, then, that it’s becoming increasingly popular to pack up and escape the cold of the west in favour of much more exotic climes when the going gets nippy. But while it’s now the perfect time of the year to drop everything and travel as far as you can from any sign of civilisation, it doesn’t mean to say you won’t be taking any essential bits of tech away with you. Well, this is what I discovered when I found myself in ...

item.title: Apple Watch study could have benefits for preventive medicine - Financial Times
item.description:
Apple Watch study could have benefits for preventive medicine  Financial Times

A global study conducted for a large insurance company with tech giant Apple has concluded that people are prepared to dramatically increase their exercise levels if they are offered tangible rewards. The insight, gleaned from data generated from 400,000 people, has implications for public policy at a time when cash-strapped health systems are struggling to curb demand for healthcare. Adrian Gore, founder of Vitality Insurance, which commissioned the survey, suggested the findings also made the case for financial services companies adjusting their business models to incentivise clients. “Th...

item.title: Yoga and Wearables: The Role Of Technology In An Ancient Discipline - Forbes
item.description:
Yoga and Wearables: The Role Of Technology In An Ancient Discipline  Forbes

When Apple launched the fourth edition of its highly-anticipated Watch wearable in September, a new update was the ability to track a yoga workout within its native fitness-recording app. While yoga has been around for literally thousands of years, it’s only fairly recently that the practice has become ubiquitous among the masses. You’d have to be a real hermit to have never heard of yoga, whether you’re into health and wellness, or not. So considering how popular yoga is these days, it’s quite surprising that it took Apple three years to add it as a dedicated, trackable option on what has ...

item.title: Trump threatens a 25% tariff on the iPhone and Apple laptops - Fast Company
item.description:
Trump threatens a 25% tariff on the iPhone and Apple laptops  Fast Company

If you’ve ever wondered why Apple’s Tim Cook has tried to remain on good terms with Donald Trump, it’s for times like these. Trump told the Wall Street Journal Monday that it’s possible the U.S. will apply new tariffs to Chinese-made consumer tech products like the iPhone. The new tariff could be either 10% or 25%, the president said. His comments come four days before he will meet Chinese leader Xi Jinping for trade talks. Trump had promised Cook that he would not place tariffs on Apple products, the New York Times reported in June, and Apple devices missed the first round of tariffs appli...

item.title: iPhone X could come back after weak sales of new Apple phones, report claims - The Independent
item.description:
iPhone X could come back after weak sales of new Apple phones, report claims  The Independent

Apple could be bringing back the iPhone X after the updates have failed to sell in high enough numbers, according to a new report. The iPhone X was killed off when the iPhone XS, XS Max and XR arrived in September this year. It is no longer available to buy through Apple stores and has been entirely replaced. But Apple is looking to resume production after those new phones didn't sell in the numbers expected, according to the Wall Street Journal. Numerous reports have suggested that the new and expensive new models have underperformed and the decision follows that, the report suggested. iPh...

item.title: Putting The Apple Watch To An Extreme Running Test - Forbes
item.description:
Putting The Apple Watch To An Extreme Running Test  Forbes

I’ve had the Series 4 Apple Watch for a little while now and decided to put it to the test for running. As an ultra runner this took the form of a super long run over seven hours. When I run it’s important to stay in touch with the family, so I need a device that will last the distance. I expected the Apple Watch to struggle to last long enough to record the run, and had previously switched to Garmin watches for these kinds of distances. To my surprise, and the Apple Watch’s credit, it lasted impressively well. After the seven hours of running I still had over 50% of charge left in the devi...

item.title: Gift This, Not That: Garmin Fenix 5 Plus vs. Apple Watch Nike+ Series 4 - Forbes
item.description:
Gift This, Not That: Garmin Fenix 5 Plus vs. Apple Watch Nike+ Series 4  Forbes

These are going to get *so* sweaty One year later, which running smartwatch do you want on your wrist? It’s complicated. Garmin Fenix 5 Plus Smart guts and run tracking? Tell me more. If you’ve spent any time at a race of any sort, you’ve seen hordes of runners, cyclists, and swimmers with Garmin devices on their wrists. And for good reason. Garmins are reliable, durable, and have batteries that last through multiple training sessions and races. Their chunky aesthetic belies a focused mission: helping you wring every last bit of data out of your workout so that you can get better. The fenix...
